Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent of anti-India and pro-Pakistan slogans raised at the ongoing farmers protest in India. The video evidence provided does show some individuals chanting these slogans, but it does not provide a comprehensive representation of the entire protest.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to prove that the raised slogans represent the views of the entire farmers protest. It only presents a short video clip without any context or broader evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the slogans raised in the video represent the beliefs and intentions of all the farmers participating in the protest. However, it does not provide any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the slogans raised in the video. It is mentioned that the video was originally published in 2015 during a protest against the desecration of a Sikh holy book. It is possible that the slogans were specific to that particular protest and not directly related to the ongoing farmers protest.
